author: USA TODAY, Bart Jansen, USA TODAY
title: 'Panic and neglect': Scientific improvements help fight pandemics like coronavirus, but funding lags between emergencies
description: Prior outbreaks such as SARS, MERS and H1N1 offer lessons in containing coronavirus. But funding for public health agencies dries up after outbreaks.
content: WASHINGTON  One virus came from an unusual kind of cat and killed hundreds of people. Another was blamed on pigs and killed 18,000 people worldwide, two-thirds of them in the U.S. A third came from camels, killed hundreds, and remains more lethal than the oth… [+16404 chars]
